intro: Neobracea martiana, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a velvety texture. Neobracea martiana is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in cool, moist climates.
